author: Mahesh Langa
text:
Gujarat continues to be on high alert, with heavy security cover across the State, in the wake of an Intelligence Bureau (IB) report that a group of 8-10 terrorists from Pakistan have sneaked in for a major terror strike.

Besides the State police, Central agencies like the Coast Guard and the BSF and four teams of the National Security Guard (NSG) have been deployed at vulnerable places like the historical Somnath temple on the Saurashtra coast.

On Monday, Chief Minister Anandiben Patel held a meeting with top officials, including the Chief Secretary and the DGP. “We apprised the Chief Minister of the steps initiated by the authorities to heighten the security cover,” DGP P.C. Thakur told media persons later.

He said the police had been carrying out search operations in coastal areas as the intelligence alert said the militants used the sea route to enter the State. “We have to take such alerts very seriously and the Central and State agencies have been coordinating to thwart the designs of terrorists,” he said.
title: Gujarat continues to be on high alert
